result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm X Benton-McKnight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sex. Assault/Unconscious Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(d).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim

PSI to be released to any medical provider for treatment purposes. De Felice's report to also be released. Sex Offender Registry Required.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

superTimeConds.notes: 20 hrs/wk if not in work, school or treatment full time.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. W/H adjudication on ct 1. If successful on probation, ct 1 can be dismissed.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victims unless approved by agent in writing.
Sex Offender assessment and follow up.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 20 hrs a week if not working, school or treatment full time.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur and concur to ct 1.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

miscConds.notes: $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

supervisions.notes: To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

AMENDED CASH BOND - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $2,500 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case. - DCBM should confirm the following: Only if DCBM believes it is able and willing to accept this defendant again.  
- Defendant must go to AA meetings/work and provide proof of participation.
- Defendant shall abide by curfew - from 9:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. and must attend 2 AA meetings a week, to be accompanied by his mother.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Z.Y.D.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

State calls Det Riley, duly sworn. Direct examination by the State.  Witness ID'd defn. Cross exam. State moves for bind over, waives argument, reserves rebuttal.  Defense argument. Court finds probable cause

AMENDED TO CASH BOND - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bail is set at $2,500 per case. This case bail shall revert to a Signature Bond on 09-11-20125 at 9:30 a.m. in the amount of $2,500 per case. Defendant must immediately report to DCBM.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,500 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant shall abide by curfew - from 9:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. and must attend 2 AA meetings a week, to be accompanied by his mother.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Z.Y.D.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Judge -  Br 2

Status conference on June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Z.Y.D.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
